headline: New Orleans Prosecutor Used Fake Subpoena To Pressure Teenage Molestation Victim, Lawyer Says
authors: The Lens, ContributorAn investigative newsroom focused on New Orleans and the Gulf ...
short descr: The documents had no legal authority. They were a ruse, essentially, to coax reluctant witnesses to talk to prosecutors.
image_caption(s): Until this spring, prosecutors in New Orleans sent notices like this that threatened jail if witnesses didn’t come in for questioning. But they weren’t legal documents because they weren’t authorized by a judge. The Lens, an investigative newsroom in New Orleans, has found six cases in which witnesses or their attorneys say they were misled by the notices.
